attributes.action: intervene personally on behalf of the two young children taken from their grandparents, who were refused permission by Edinburgh Social Services to adopt their own grandchildren and instead placed them with complete strangers, so that the family may be reunited.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition concerns the well-publicised case of two children which Edinburgh Social Services would not allow their grandchildren to adopt, choosing instead to place them with a gay couple. When the grandparents objected they were threatened by Social Services with never seeing their grandchildren again. This appeal is for the Prime Minister to intervene so that a case apparently determined by ideology might be reexamined with a view to reuniting the family.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
